refnamediv.refpurpose: Delays an input signal by some time interval.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A signal can be read from or written into a delay path, or it can be automatically delayed by some time interval.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: idlt -- requested delay time in seconds. This can be as large as available memory will permit. The space required for n seconds of delay is 4n * sr bytes. It is allocated at the time the instrument is first initialized, and returned to the pool at the end of a score section.
iskip (optional, default=0) -- initial disposition of delay-loop data space (see reson). The default value is 0.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: delay is a composite of delayr and delayw, both reading from and writing into its own storage area. It can thus accomplish signal time-shift, although modified feedback is not possible. There is no minimum delay period.
